intro: Parahellenia yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan parahellenia, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable species for botanical study and conservation efforts.
